abstract: Steve Jobs will be giving out bumpers and cases for the iPhone 4. And in case you missed it, he doesn’t exactly have a crush on reporters.
snippet: Steve Jobs will be giving out bumpers and cases for the iPhone 4. And in case you missed it, he doesn’t exactly have a crush on reporters.
lead_paragraph: By now, most people know what happens when your fingers come in contact with the lower left-hand corner of the iPhone 4 — are you there? — but it took the touch of an old-line, nontech tester of technology to get Apple to admit as much.

headline.main: Post-Mortem: No Hair Shirt for Steve Jobs
headline.print_headline: Post-Mortem: No Hair Shirt For Steve Jobs

abstract: Steve Jobs was critical of the media for exaggerating iPhone 4’s problem, but he couldn’t criticize Consumer Reports.
snippet: Steve Jobs was critical of the media for exaggerating iPhone 4’s problem, but he couldn’t criticize Consumer Reports.
lead_paragraph: In today’s Media Equation column, David Carr writes:

abstract: An Apple press conference that was meant to ease concerns over the iPhone 4’s antenna problems set off more debate.
snippet: An Apple press conference that was meant to ease concerns over the iPhone 4’s antenna problems set off more debate.
lead_paragraph: “You are now entering the Steve Jobs Reality Distortion Field.” These were the words I heard from several journalists when I first started writing about Apple for Bits last year.

headline.main: Fallout From the iPhone 4 Press Conference
